meanings.definition: To slow down or reduce speed.
meanings.sent1: The car decelerates when approaching a red light.
meanings.sent2: She decelerates her bike before making a sharp turn.
meanings.sent3: The snail decelerates to enjoy the view of the garden.
meanings.sent4: Time seems to decelerate when waiting for something exciting.
meanings.sent5: The parachute decelerates the skydiver's fall, ensuring a safe landing.

meanings.sent1: The car moves decelerates on the icy road.
meanings.sent2: She skated decelerates to avoid crashing into the wall.
meanings.sent3: The sloth climbs decelerates up the tree, taking its time.
meanings.sent4: The music gradually decelerates, creating a calming effect.
meanings.sent5: The airplane decelerates smoothly before landing on the runway.
